categories.name: Canadian Geography: From Coast to Coast

questions.clue: For 200 points: This city, known for its proximity to the Rockies and hosting events like the 2010 Winter Olympics, is also famous for its diverse food scene including pizza.
For 400 points: Located on the St. Lawrence River, this city is known for the iconic Montreal Canadiens and its unique style of pizza.
For 600 points: This eastern city is home to the CFL team the Tiger-Cats and is known for its industrial past and growing cultural scene.
For 800 points: Known as the 'Gateway to the North', this city in Alberta is a hub for oil and gas industries and hosts the Fringe Festival, second only to Edinburgh's.
For 1000 points: This remote island province boasts the only officially bilingual province in Canada and is famous for its natural beauty, including Gros Morne National Park.

categories.name: The Art of Anime: From Classics to Contemporary

questions.clue: This anime features a boy named Ash Ketchum and his electric-type Pokémon, Pikachu, on a quest to become a Pokémon Master.
Known for its sports theme, this anime follows the story of a volleyball team striving to win the national championship.
This iconic anime film by Studio Ghibli features a young girl named Chihiro who becomes trapped in a mysterious world of spirits.
Set in the futuristic city of Neo-Tokyo, this groundbreaking anime film follows the story of Kaneda and his gang of motorcycle-riding friends.
This anime, popular in Canada, features a group of pirates led by Monkey D. Luffy in their search for the One Piece treasure.

categories.name: Pizza: A Culinary Journey Through Toppings and Styles

questions.clue: For $200: This style of pizza, known for its thick crust and abundant toppings, originated in Chicago.
For $400: Named after a famous Italian queen, this classic pizza is topped with tomatoes, mozzarella, and basil, representing the colors of the Italian flag.
For $600: A favorite among anime characters in Tokyo, this pizza topping might include seafood like squid and tuna, popular in Japan.
For $800: Known for its folded-over style, this Italian dish shares its name with a position in many sports, often filled with ricotta and mozzarella.
For $1000: In Vancouver, Canada, this controversial pizza topping, often paired with ham, sparked a global debate over its place on pizza.

categories.name: Sports Legends: Icons and Their Impact

questions.clue: This basketball legend, known as 'His Airness', had a significant impact both on and off the court, including a famous partnership with Nike.
This Canadian hockey player, often referred to as 'The Great One', holds the record for the most goals in NHL history.
This Brazilian soccer icon, known for his incredible skills and three World Cup wins, is often considered one of the greatest footballers of all time.
This tennis legend from Switzerland has won 20 Grand Slam titles and is known for his elegant playing style and sportsmanship.
This Canadian sprinter was stripped of his 1988 Olympic gold medal in the 100 meters after testing positive for steroids, highlighting doping issues in sports.

categories.name: Vancouver's Vibrant Culture: A City of Diversity

questions.clue: For sports fans, Vancouver is home to this NHL team, known for its blue and green colors.
This annual festival in Vancouver celebrates Japanese animation and pop culture, attracting anime enthusiasts from across the region.
In Vancouver, you can find this popular style of pizza, known for its thin crust and unique toppings, originating from Naples, Italy.
Vancouver's diverse culinary scene includes this type of Chinese cuisine, noted for its dim sum offerings, especially in the Richmond area.
This Vancouver-based film event is among the top five in North America, showcasing a wide range of international films and celebrating diverse cultures.

final.clue: Opened in 1983 and famously known for its retractable roof, this venue in Vancouver is home to both a CFL team and a professional soccer team.
